channel.title: CVE Feed for wpcalc -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpcalc -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-0895|2024-08-02T05:24:34.626Z -- wpcalc -- wp%20coder%20%E2%80%93%20add%20custom%20html%2C%20css%20and%20js%20code
item.description: The WP Coder – add custom html, css and js code plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to time-based SQL Injection via the ‘id’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 2.5.3 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with administrative privileges to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

item.title: CVE-2023-5161|2024-08-02T07:52:07.542Z -- wpcalc -- modal%20window%20%E2%80%93%20create%20popup%20modal%20window
item.description: The Modal Window plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via shortcodes in versions up to, and including, 5.3.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2457|2024-08-01T19:11:53.578Z -- wpcalc -- modal%20window%20%E2%80%93%20create%20popup%20modal%20window
item.description: The Modal Window – create popup modal window plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to, and including, 5.3.8 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2457|2024-06-04T17:29:01.167Z -- wpcalc -- modal%20window%20%E2%80%93%20create%20popup%20modal%20window
item.description: The Modal Window – create popup modal window plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to, and including, 5.3.8 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
